item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

the elve age:

• Rippln plans to reward you for the value of the marketplace

I plan to be an astronaut

the elve age:

• “Diane Hawkman” executive w/ 14 years of marketing experience

Did a search on “Diane Hawkman” and found no information at all (which is odd, because I’m sure all the addresses that RippLn listed were also fake?)

the elve age:

• Gives user an opportunity to establish an ecosystem in the marketplace that you can distribute your own goods or services through your own ripple.

Does it do that? Or does it just plan to do that whilst becoming as big as Facebook and selling futuristic watches.

the elve age:

• The game “4pics” is a game by Rippln

App Store

4 Pics 1 Word on the App Store

Read reviews, compare customer ratings, see screenshots, and learn more about 4 Pics 1 Word. Download 4 Pics 1 Word and enjoy it on your iPhone, iPad, and iPod touch.


“By LOTUM GmbH”
http://www.lotum.de/

Are you sure it’s a game by rippln?

the elve age:

• With the app’s ‘ingame purchases’, users create the game’s revenue mold

That makes no sense whatsoever. Users pay money for ingame purchases, and users also earn money from ingame purchases? That would surely result in no profit for the company… why would any company choose to operate at a loss?

[quote=“the elve age, post:67, topic:527239”]• Have fun, get money :P[/quote]I’d rather fuck bitches

the elve age:

Take picture of watch
Set up Bluetooth on other phone
Change other phone’s name to “Martian Watch”

[quote=“the elve age, post:67, topic:527239”]• One of Rippln’s first product[/quote]I thought they were a social network bigger than Facebook and Twitter (and obviously MySpace)

[quote=“the elve age, post:67, topic:527239”]• Open Authentication - this is where Rippln will succeed[/quote]Are they not going to succeed at being larger than some of the worlds most successful companies, then?

[quote=“the elve age, post:67, topic:527239”]• Facebook Open Authentication (You can link Facebook with just about every website now a days, Rippln plans to be there next to Twitter, Facebook, etc.)[/quote]Facebook isn’t a ridiculous pyramid scheme, though. Again, more “plans”.

[quote=“the elve age, post:67, topic:527239”]• Once Rippln is linked on various websites, Rippln will track what you buy and sell and will track just about anything you do in your ripple.[/quote]If RippLn is linked on various websites, I think you mean. So you’ll be constantly tracked by a company that you can’t remove your details from? Nice!

the elve age:

• Will get revenue from adsense on your Ripple page (or they plan to)

Again, more plans.

the elve age:

Try to join us on Thursday if you can.

No, they might brainwash me like they have you.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

Here’s my notes from last night’s call. Try to join us on Thursday if you can.

Opportunity
• Rippln plans to reward you for the value of the marketplace

• “Diane Hawkman” executive w/ 14 years of marketing experience

• Gives user an opportunity to establish an ecosystem in the marketplace that you can distribute your own goods or services through your own ripple.

• User Generated “social generated” game
• The game “4pics” is a game by Rippln
• “Guess the photo” type
• With the app’s ‘ingame purchases’, users create the game’s revenue mold
• Have fun, get money

1zq7tp4.png577×1024

• Martian smartwatch
• Basically a smartphone in a watch.
• One of Rippln’s first product

• Open Authentication - this is where Rippln will succeed
• Facebook Open Authentication (You can link Facebook with just about every website now a days, Rippln plans to be there next to Twitter, Facebook, etc.)
• Once Rippln is linked on various websites, Rippln will track what you buy and sell and will track just about anything you do in your ripple.
• Will get revenue from adsense on your Ripple page (or they plan to)

Read full topic

Amazon, Twitter and other mass multi-media sites didn’t promise to earn their users millions of pounds[/quote]And neither did this company. item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:56, topic:527239”]9PM in what timezone lol[/quote]EST my bad

If you’re still unsure of the benefits of RippLn or confused on what the fudge it is, this letter is for you.

This is a letter written to Joe who's not quite sure of Rippln or its potential despite having 80 in his current ripple.

You’ll get paid when any of the 80 on your team or more as it grows purchase anything…let me try to clarify where this is going Joe.

The Rippln/App platform is going to be FREE to all who want to be fans (Users of the apps and buyers of the offers and upgrades and music and all the other stuff)

Apps, games, music, movie tickets, concerts, sporting events…anything you can imagine in the virtual space being sold and bought from a smart phone or tablet today…Like a Fandango, EventBrite, ITunes, Stub Hub, App store all wrapped into one. (PLUS an incredible communicator!)

Then combine that with hard goods Joe. Think Amazon for a bit…Now, you have a person that owns a surfboard manufacturing business and he is in your ripple somewhere. He puts his boards and accessories on the Rippln platform because there are 20+ million eyeballs or more watching…Every surfboard he sells (say 2 per week) u make a cut of the transaction fee of 2-4%. On a $2,000 surf board, you are going to share in $20 to $40 commissions paid out. This is just one idea with one product. Imagine thousands of products flowing through this platform!

So, now think back to when Jeff Bezos first started Amazon.
It was an online book seller, right?
Now, 10 yrs later you can buy almost anything from Amazon…BUT, they don’t pay you for everyone you referred to the amazon retail platform or any sales made on that platform.

Rippln WILL…

So on to the first app we release a words with friends type game…the developing team released an app and in a few short months it has 20 million downloads…it’s called 4Pics.

If someone shares the game (app) and the rippln platform with someone else that shares it with someone else, every time there is a transaction that takes place, in the virtual world or the hard good world, you will earn money because you are a player. The fans will be rewarded in a points system for using and sharing within the Rippln platform.

Now throw in the element of Ad Revenue for a moment…

Ford, Home Depot, Kellogs, Microsoft, Apple and all the other major corporations all want eyeballs to see their logos and offers, right?

Think about a company that is going to share in the ad revenue space with its people who helped build the ripples. Pretty cool eh?

Our goal should be to keep expanding and building our ripples, so one day you have 200,000 people or more globally in your ripple.

If there is going to be 200 Million on the Rippln Platform over the next 3 to 5 years, someone is going to get paid for the transactions…it might as well be you…You have a 80 member ripple already started.

Let me wrap by saying this…Rippln, I believe will become the BIGGEST or one of the biggest online distribution networks in the world because we are in the incentivized space and NO one else is…Everyone else is keeping all the monies, we are paying them out to the players.

So to become a player its a yearly fee of $69.95 and to earn weekly or monthly income it’s $25 dollars per month. (Small price in the BIG pic) and if you want to do it now, you should have a green light in your commerce section of your Rippln back office.

Payments will be cut to you right onto a Rippln Visa every week potentially.

Does this clear up the picture a little bit for you Joe!

This ones gonna be BIG, you don’t want to miss it!

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:

[quote=“Lin, post:48, topic:527239”][quote author=the elve age link=topic=645984.msg4344997#msg4344997 date=1375743394]

[quote author=Ambokile link=topic=645984.msg4344983#msg4344983 date=1375742188]

RippLn is justice.

What the
[/quote]You’ll see soon enough
[/quote]You have a little bit of brown on your nose. It’s right there.[/quote]You know I’m kidding right? I’m not that weird :P. But I am a strong supporter of the idea, I just wouldn’t go as far to say “RippLn is justice” without having a smirk on my face haha. I’ve heard some of the developers use that phrase and clearly it sparked a bit of an uproar from our moparians.

[quote=“Vain_, post:53, topic:527239”]Sounds more retarded than those mass advertised bidding sites where you pay money just to bid, losing money whether you buy the item or not and more retarded than referral sites.[/quote]It’s just as retarded as Amazon, Twitter or any mass multi-media site.

There’s going to be a cover-up conference call with anything that you might have missed if you didn’t attend the meeting in Dallas. It’ll have lead developers and executives from RippLn and if you want to find out more I’d join. There’s going to be at least 500 people there. @ 9pm

item.description:
@iz3_legend wrote:

No, you’ll see soon enough that this is NOT a revolutionary system. I also like the way they portrayed the creators of Facebook, very mature of them…

You said this is Justice? Id strongly urge you to re-think anything you may know about justice. Programs like this are only concerned with one thing, money. They’ll use idiots to spread the word of a supposedly miracle like system, and where better to find those idiots than on the internet.

item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:45, topic:527239”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=645984.msg4344936#msg4344936 date=1375736921]
this idea is strange as hell, I dont even know what to think about it. It’s certainly working in terms of making them money and they haven’t been shut down or sued yet… sooooo who knows.
[/quote]It goes deeper than what the general public thinks. After an hour of talking on the phone with my friend, I completely believe this is real. It’s still really hard to explain what’s happening here.

It isn’t a ponzi scheme or a pyramid scheme. I won’t do the company justice by explaining it over on MoparScape, but the general idea is it’s suppose to be an advanced Amazon.

So where marketers, entrepeuners, etc will list their product on RippLn, and we as consumers can either pass it on to our “Ripple” or ignore, if we pass it on to our ripple, RippLn will keep track of how many people were referred to that product from your ripple. I’m still a bit confused about how payouts work, but supposedly the sooner you get involved the easier you can make money.

This isn’t a scam, scheme or anyway to get money out of you, this is a legit website and business. I’m 100% convinced that this will become the next big thing. I won’t be able to convince any of you, you have to convince yourself about the good of RippLn.

RippLn is justice.[/quote]
Just wondering… is RippLn some kind of brain washing cult? Because that’s how you make it sound.

Read full topic
